content:
To the Honorable Judge of the Court:

I, [Your Name], am writing this letter as my trial by written declaration for the speeding ticket I received on [Date of Ticket]. I am contesting the ticket for the following reasons:

1. I was not speeding at the time of the citation. I maintain that I was driving at a safe and legal speed.
2. The officer who issued the citation did not use a speed-measuring device to determine my speed. The officer simply judged my speed based on their own observation, which is subjective and unreliable.
3. I was not given the opportunity to challenge the citation at the time it was issued. I was not provided with a notice to appear in court or a written notice of the citation.

I request that the court dismiss the citation and find me not guilty. I am enclosing copies of any relevant evidence, including the citation and any documents or photographs that support my case.

Thank you for considering my trial by written declaration.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
